dcterms:creator: Emiel H Por
Sebastiaan Y Haffert
Vikram M Radhakrishnan
David S Doelman
Maaike van Kooten
Steven P Bos
dcterms:description: HCIPy is an open-source adaptive optics and coronagraph simulator that provides a comprehensive set of libraries related to adaptive optics, including wavefront generation, atmospheric turbulence modeling, propagation simulation, fiber coupling, and implementation of deformable mirrors and wavefront sensors.
dcterms:title: HCIPy: High Contrast Imaging for Python

dcterms:description: Shack-Hartmann wavefront sensor data is used as a benchmark for comparing the performance of reinforcement learning algorithms in improving light coupling performance in the presence of atmospheric turbulence.
dcterms:title: Shack-Hartmann wavefront sensor data

dcterms:description: ALPAO adaptive optics deformable mirrors are used in the context of adaptive optics systems to correct wavefront distortions.
dcterms:title: ALPAO adaptive optics deformable mirrors

dcterms:description: Reinforcement Learning algorithms such as Soft-Actor-Critic (SAC), Deep Deterministic Policy Gradient (DDPG), and Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) are used to develop control policies for wavefront sensorless adaptive optics.
dcterms:title: Reinforcement Learning algorithms (SAC, DDPG, PPO)

dcterms:description: Atmospheric turbulence conditions represented by the parameter D/r0 are used to assess the performance of adaptive optics systems under different levels of turbulence.
dcterms:title: Atmospheric turbulence conditions represented by the parameter D/r0
